Eyes, mouth & ears symptom reports

Female, 26 - 39 years

Age Reported Symptoms Notes
26 2020-12-31 eye swelling 12/28/2020 around 5:30 PM she started getting itchy. Progressing as night went on. On 12/29/2020 ar... Read more
Close
12/28/2020 around 5:30 PM she started getting itchy. Progressing as night went on. On 12/29/2020 around 5-6:00 AM you woke with hives, hoarse voice and eyes swollen. A little SOB with talking. Also had weakness and tingling. Tingling was "everywhere".. Went to ER. Treated in the ER and released. Also on this day she had additional reaction to prednisone and she found out she is allergic to this. On 12/31/2020 she had to return to ER. She was at work and not feeling the greatest. Feeling light headed on and off. Continued to work and while driving home felt confused and light headed and called co workers. Felt weak again.. Called co workers who work for ambulance service They came and checked her out and her B/P was high and having PVC's per the heart monitor Transported to ER per the ambulance. 1/1/2021 she is feeling better. Received fluids last night. ER felt it was due to receiving vaccine and then additional allergic reaction to prednisone.
26 2021-01-03 lacrimation increased Bell?s Palsy. Right-sided facial drooping. Numbness to right face. Excessive tearing of right eye as... Read more
Close
Bell?s Palsy. Right-sided facial drooping. Numbness to right face. Excessive tearing of right eye associated with inability to blink right eye.
26 2021-01-03 sensitivity to light Day of vaccine: Headache/migraine with light sensitivity, severe nausea (constant need to throw up f... Read more
Close
Day of vaccine: Headache/migraine with light sensitivity, severe nausea (constant need to throw up for 4-5 hours), vomiting, body aches. Day after: Shakiness, dizziness, slight nausea - unable to work
26 2021-01-03 dry mouth got the shot around 11 am on 12/26 and my mouth became immediately parched. My arm was super sore a... Read more
Close
got the shot around 11 am on 12/26 and my mouth became immediately parched. My arm was super sore as the day went on and around 4:30 am I woke up shivering with chills and aches and a mild temp of 99. Passed out and BP was extremely low. Parents called an ambulance and I went to Emergency room.
26 2021-01-03 vision blurred, visual impairment pt experienced blurred vision with dark spots and chest tightness Rph gave 1 diphenhydramine 25mg pt... Read more
Close
pt experienced blurred vision with dark spots and chest tightness Rph gave 1 diphenhydramine 25mg pt went home with husband
26 2021-01-04 mouth tingling Pt. reported feeling itchy all over her body approximately 1 hour after receiving Moderna Vaccine. ... Read more
Close
Pt. reported feeling itchy all over her body approximately 1 hour after receiving Moderna Vaccine. Pt. was given oral Loratadine and Benadryl 50mg at approximately 12:05 and found relief with medications but also reported a tingling sensation on both sides of cheeks that extended to her lips. At approximately 1:30 pt. reported feeling heart palpitations, Dr. ordered an EKG - results were nornal. An IV was started at this time and pt. received . IV Bolus of LR 1 L was administered. Pt. was evaluated by Dr. and discharged home at approximately 4pm that same day. Pt. symptoms did not worsen
26 2021-01-05 mouth tingling 12/24/2020 I started with a wooshing feeling immediately after the vaccine, I sat down for 15 mins a... Read more
Close
12/24/2020 I started with a wooshing feeling immediately after the vaccine, I sat down for 15 mins and felt dizzy so I stayed another 15 mins. BP was 140 and abnormal I had juice and felt better and went back to work and I felt tingling all over my body and fainty and my legs felt very heavy. I went upstairs and my BP was 160's and heart rate was 120 and I went to the ER. My face appeared to be swollen and my tounge felt tingly and I was given fluids and benadryl and solumedrol . My BP was in the 140's I went home to get rest and I still felt tingly for a couple days. The next day I felt feverish my arm was sore and I went to doctor gave me a rx for anxiety and I stayed home and rested from work for a few days. My tinglyness subsided after the medication
26 2021-01-06 vision blurred An hour after receiving the first dose of the Moderna vaccine I experienced mild blurry vision. This... Read more
Close
An hour after receiving the first dose of the Moderna vaccine I experienced mild blurry vision. This lasted about 30 minutes then went away with no other problems.
26 2021-01-06 sensitivity to light Around 11pm started having chills. Around 3:00am. fever, started shaking, had temperature 104 around... Read more
Close
Around 11pm started having chills. Around 3:00am. fever, started shaking, had temperature 104 around 5: AM vomited and is having headache, had trouble breathing like someone was pushing on her chest last night. Now she is talking normal. Headache is bad and the light hurts her eyes.

Close
Fever, diaphoretic, full body muscle aches, swollen and painful lymph nodes in the right side of the neck, muscle pain at the injections site in right arm, metallic taste in mouth, fatigue, headache.

Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine EUA 12/28- vaccinated, felt like I was punched in the arm, headache 8 hours later 12/29-very bad pain at injection site and weakness in that arm, intense headache throughout the entire day, body aches especially in knees and back, exhaustion, mild nausea 12/30- pain and weakness at injection site, mild headache, mild joint pain, throat felt scratchy, mild itchy rash on waist (red/pink with some bumps, golf ball sized) 12/31- pain and weakness at injection site, mild head and joint aches 1/1- 1/5 head ache 1/5 - 1/7 itchy, puffy, red rash at injection site, tennis ball sized, hot to touch, puffiness feels firm
26 2021-01-06 eye pain PATIENT IS EXPERIENCING BODY ACHES, FATIGUE, NAUSEA, HEADACHE, AND EYE PAIN.

Close
At 1545 patient c/o tingling lips. At 1600 patient c/o trouble swallowing and Epi 0.3mg administered at 1605 in R thigh. At 1613 patient reported trouble swallowing wasn't improving, 25mg po Benadryl given without difficulty and 911 called.
26 2021-01-07 dry mouth Myalgia, Fever & NauseaVomiting Narrative: Employee states that symptoms did not start until the mid... Read more
Close
Myalgia, Fever & NauseaVomiting Narrative: Employee states that symptoms did not start until the middle of the night after injection. States she woke up with "severe" arm pain, headache, dry mouth, nausea, body aches and fever. Highest noted to be 101.4
26 2021-01-07 swollen tongue initial; swelling of tongue, tingling and numbness in legs, syncope. later; HA
26 2021-01-07 vision blurred lightheadedness, pulse increase to 112 bpm, temperature increase, headache/migraine, blurry vision.
26 2021-01-11 mouth tingling, swollen tongue Within 1 hour of receiving the vaccine the patient developed asthma symptoms,dizziness, tingling in ... Read more
Close
Within 1 hour of receiving the vaccine the patient developed asthma symptoms,dizziness, tingling in mouth and swollen tongue. She presented at a walk-in clinic and received Epi-Pen 0.3mg, Solu-Medrol and Benadryl, while there she received 2 additional doses and was transferred to the nearest ED by ambulance. At the ED she received a 4th dose of Epi-Pen 0.3mg and albuterol and DuoNeb treatments. She was admitted for observation. She went home and needed to return within 24 hours to the ED because her lips and tongue started to swell and she turned blue. She subsequently needed 3 additional doses of Epi-Pen over the next 24-48 hours. She has been on Benadryl 50mg every 6 hours and Famodine 20mg until present.
26 2021-01-12 mouth numbness, dry throat Pt received COVID19 Vaccine (Moderna) on 1/8/2021 at 1:52PM. -Pt felt fine immediately after the v... Read more
Close
Pt received COVID19 Vaccine (Moderna) on 1/8/2021 at 1:52PM. -Pt felt fine immediately after the vaccine. -10 min later was reporting dizziness and that her tongue felt numb for 1 minute. -Also reported dry (but not itchy) throat. -I evaluated patient. -Denies itchy/sore throat, itchy/watery eyes, rash, difficulty breathing, shortness of breath, N/V, chest pain, numbness/tingling, swelling. -Pt's symptoms subsided within 10 minutes after she rested and was given water. -She was observed for ~30 minutes total and discharged.
26 2021-01-14 swollen tongue At approximately 17:15, time of discharge ,(15 minutes after vaccination) client stated that her lef... Read more
Close
At approximately 17:15, time of discharge ,(15 minutes after vaccination) client stated that her left arm was itchy as well as both hands. Injection site area with pink hue but no hives. She also stated she felt a little something in her throat. Vital signs at this time were 143/85 BP, Heart rate 100 and O2 sat 96%. No sob. 17:19 she complained of a sensation of tongue swelling. VS 138/82, HR 90, O2 sat 96% and no SOB. Continued to monitor VS every 3 minutes. Pt offered IM Benadryl but refused. 17:22 132/87, HR 99, O2 sat 95%, 17:25 133/85 HR 90 O2 95% 17:29 132/82 HR 93, O2 sat 96%, denies any new symptoms at this time. 17:34 128/89 HR 88, O2 sat 96%, 17:38 134/85 HR 93 O2 sat 95%. States symptoms improving. 17:41 129/84 HR 93 and O2 sat95%, 17:73 133/83 HR 86 , O2 sat 96%. Pt. symptoms cont. to improve. 17:55 131/83 HR 86 O2 sat 95%. Pt states she feel better. Planes to take oral Benadryl as soon as she gets home. She was advised to consult with primary physician regarding this event and will follow up with physician if she chooses to receive a second dose of Moderna COVID 19 vaccine at her doctors office. She left at 17:56.
26 2021-01-14 lip swelling anaphylaxis by lethargy, nausea, vomiting, palpitations, funny feeling in chest, swollen lips

Client experienced a tingling sensation in the throat after vaccination. The tingling subsided after a few minutes.

10:30 pm: fatigue and chills 12:00am (1/15/21):100.5 degree fever, headache, neck pain on both sides, pain in joints of hands, neck, knees, ankles and pelvis, ear ache on the right side, skin hypersensitivity 1:00am (1/15/21): 100.9 degree fever, pain in wrists and hands with inability to grip pencil, burning pain in abdomen at skin crease, burning pain in left armpit, pain in joints of hand, wrists, elbow, pelvis, hips, throughout left deltoid near injection site, 2:00am (1/15/21): 99.3 degree fever, profusely sweating, chills
26 2021-01-17 sensitivity to light Extremely intense headache that lasted approximately 10 hours. Headache caused nausea, sensitivity t... Read more
Close
Extremely intense headache that lasted approximately 10 hours. Headache caused nausea, sensitivity to light and sensitivity to sound. I took naproxen 500mg and 1000mg tylenol and neither did anything for the pain. I also tried ice and heat, neither of which helped with the pain either. Pain reached intensity of 7.5/10. This was by far the worst headache I've ever experienced.
26 2021-01-17 vision blurred I received the first dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine on 1/4/21. On 1/12/21 I developed blurred vis... Read more
Close
I received the first dose of the Moderna COVID vaccine on 1/4/21. On 1/12/21 I developed blurred vision in my right eye that is still present. The vision is in my periphery, lower right quadrant. It comes and goes but is mostly present throughout the day.
26 2021-01-17 visual impairment Shortly after the injection I started feeling light headed.. as the 15 minute window went on I also ... Read more
Close
Shortly after the injection I started feeling light headed.. as the 15 minute window went on I also got super dizzy and my vision started going out.. a few minutes after that happened my chest started tightening up and my breathing became very labored and difficult. They hospital staff came and checked my vitals and gave me Benadryl. They put me on a stretcher and rushed me down to the er.
26 2021-01-17 visual impairment Shortly after the injection I started getting light headed. As a few minutes went on I also started ... Read more
Close
Shortly after the injection I started getting light headed. As a few minutes went on I also started getting really dizzy and the room started spinning and my vision started going out. About 15 minutes after the injection my chest started tightening up and labored my breathing and it became very difficult to breathe. They loaded me on a stretcher and took me down to the er.
26 2021-01-18 pain in jaw 1/7/21 - developed widespread tooth sensitivity to hot and cold food 1/11/21 - woke up in the middle... Read more
Close
1/7/21 - developed widespread tooth sensitivity to hot and cold food 1/11/21 - woke up in the middle of the night with severe tooth and jaw pain on the lower right side 1/12/21 and 1/13/21 - pain spread to include upper and lower jaw/teeth on the right side of my mouth 1/14/21 and 1/15/21 - pain resolved in right lower jaw, pain still present in right upper jaw 1/16/21 - pain isolated to upper right jaw and last molar, could not eat without pain 1/17/21 and 1/18/21 - pain still present but mostly resolved, hot and cold sensitivity recurred During this timeframe, pain was managed with acetaminophen 1000mg and ibuprofen 800mg as needed
26 2021-01-18 eye pain Burning/tingling pain on eyebrow, over the course of three weeks burning stinging sensation moved to... Read more
Close
Burning/tingling pain on eyebrow, over the course of three weeks burning stinging sensation moved to cover left side of face, left eyeball, and arm. Painful. No visible rash.
26 2021-01-19 visual impairment 1/19 4:30 PM- extreme body soreness (especially injection site/left arm), headache, chills, and felt... Read more
Close
1/19 4:30 PM- extreme body soreness (especially injection site/left arm), headache, chills, and felt like I had a fever (with no fever). 1/19 8:00 PM- Hallucinations began (with eyes closed and open) - started seeing unfamiliar people (faces and outlines), black and white strobing along with seeing pure red light at certain points, I could not control the hallucinations, extreme paranoia (like I was being controlled and watched), physical symptoms magically went away; however, I had pressure in my head that did not hurt like a headache. I was talking to people that were not there. I felt completely out of control. The only thing that helped was forcing myself to focus on the TV, which was extremely difficult. Symptoms started to die down around 3 AM, but did not go away. I slept for 4 hours. 1/20 8 AM- felt like and still feel like I am not in reality, I feel disassociated with my body (like its not mine), slightly out of control of my thoughts, I see subtle black and white flashing like last night but not as intense, paranoia like last night/not as intense, cant concentrate.
26 2021-01-19 oropharyngeal discomfort Patient got vaccine & waited onsite 15minutes. Stated thought her throat felt a little funny but wa... Read more
Close
Patient got vaccine & waited onsite 15minutes. Stated thought her throat felt a little funny but wasn't sure; denied any other symptoms. Continued waiting as requested. 10-15minutes later while nurse was tending to two other patients, patient approached crying & stating concern may be feeling worse. Monitored along with the two other patients. Conversed with other recovering patient & calmed & laughed. States she thinks she was just anxious. BP130/86. Left ambulatory @2:50pm.
26 2021-01-19 dry throat fever 103, hives on face , neck , back and chest,, dry throat , mild sob, mild lightheadedness

1-21-21 @ 11 pm - chills started,with 98.7 F fever. Body aches and headache. They continued all night and still going today 1-22-21 @ 5:08pm. Temperature continues to go up it has not gone down from 102.5 F. In the past 2 hours after taking Tylenol at 3:30pm. feels very thirsty, have drank 4- 24oz of water, a bottle of 28oz Gatorade. Shortness of breath started 8:45 am 1-22-21 Fast heart rate and feels heart skip started around 3:30pm 1-22-21 took 500mg Tylenol at 3 am Took 1000mg Tylenol at 7:30 am Took 420 mg Naproxen @ 9:30 am Took 1000 mg Tylenol @ 3:30pm

Close
Immediately felt tongue swelling. Moderate to Severe body chills, temporal and frontal headaches for 4 days, severe body aches, moderate nausea for 72 hrs, and severe arm soreness. Hives at the injection arm two weeks later.

My arm injection site was hurting. I had stabbing pains in my lower back like a knife into my spine. I had a fever, chills, dizziness, body aches, light headed. I could not hold my eyes open cause light was too bright. I had a migraine and nausea and vomiting. I had a knife stabbing sensation in my chest that did not stop. I was short of breathe and wheezing. Very itchy all over my body mainly on whole left side where I got the injection. Very tired and felt like I could not move

26 2021-01-29 lip swelling Swollen lips, cheeks, airway. Red flush face.
26 2021-01-31 dry throat, mouth tingling Received her second Moderna vaccine dosage at 3:45pm today. At 3:55pm she felt flush and tachycardic... Read more
Close
Received her second Moderna vaccine dosage at 3:45pm today. At 3:55pm she felt flush and tachycardic, with a dry throat and tingling lips. She is unsure if this is anxiety from vaccination or a reaction. She prophylactically took ibuprofen prior to coming in for her vaccine. No history of anaphylaxis. No history of SARS-COV-2. We called for review instructing to provide 10mg cetirizine (given at 4:02pm). Dose #1 she had experienced low grade fever, myalgias (mild) Her vital signs at 3:55pm BP 145/82; HR 113; SpO2 100%; T 98 F She appears mildly flush on her face and ears. No hives or rash. No SOB, CP, N/V/D; Vitals at 4:06 after cetirizine BP 129/85 HR 100 SpO2 100% Advised to take a second antihistamine if allergies continue when she gets home.
26 2021-02-01 eye swelling Right eye was found to be swollen at 0600 the morning after receiving the vaccine. It completely res... Read more
Close
Right eye was found to be swollen at 0600 the morning after receiving the vaccine. It completely resolved within 2 hours

Close
patient reports lip tingling and swelling, 2 hrs later reports chest tightness. Patient given 0.3mg epinephrine injection. Pt transferred to ED with EMT. In ED patient given NS bolus, Pepcid, Benadryl and solumedrol. Discharged at approx. 1615
26 2021-02-16 taste disorder a few days after getting the first dose I noticed that my BMs has a different smell to it. Thought t... Read more
Close
a few days after getting the first dose I noticed that my BMs has a different smell to it. Thought that it was a bit of a change due to just getting the shot. Then the next day I had breakfast and it had a hint of that smell and taste. but didn't think nothing of it thought they were just having a bad day. I still had that smell when i used the restroom. Seemed like when i got the second dose the smell became stronger. At work I walked into a certain room and it had that smell, which was weird cause it's a distinctive smell . It's hard to describe, but it's like a spoiled. sulfur, gasoline smell. I ordered the bread pasta bowl from and it had that gross smell so i couldn't eat it. I love peanut butter, but i noticed that foul taste. I smelt it and had a hint of that gross smell and a bit of PB. The coffee at work has that gross smell to it as well. Certain foods, drinks, or odors have that smell and taste to me. So I'm pretty much trying to figure out what foods and drinks i can have and what places i can go to. I get Covid around November, and i did loose taste and smell.
26 2021-02-21 vision blurred Fatigue, headache, body aches and chills, fever, nausea and vomiting, blurred vision, loss of appeti... Read more
Close
Fatigue, headache, body aches and chills, fever, nausea and vomiting, blurred vision, loss of appetite.
26 2021-02-23 feeling of choking Pt received Moderna COVID- 19 Vaccine at 8:30am and sent to observation lobby. Pt reports tingling ... Read more
Close
Pt received Moderna COVID- 19 Vaccine at 8:30am and sent to observation lobby. Pt reports tingling and swelling symptoms of throat at 8:40. Pt was brought into exam room for further assessment. EMS called at 8:40 AM to further assess pt. Pt showing elevated BP and HR at 8:41. 0.3 mg of Epinephrine Auto-injector administered at 8:42. Pt reported immediate relief of symptoms. EMS arrived at 8:46 and began assessing. Pt refused transport to hospital. 25 mg Benadryl PO given at 8:45 AM. Pt report she is feeling fine and is okay to drive home. Pt left for home 9:00 AM. Pt called HD at 9:15 to report she arrived safely.
26 2021-02-25 eye swelling, feeling of choking, lacrimation increased, mouth numbness Swelling of face and eyes, watery eyes, itchy throat with tingling and numbness in lips and nose, it... Read more
Close
Swelling of face and eyes, watery eyes, itchy throat with tingling and numbness in lips and nose, itchy hands and ears. Was given PO Benadryl at medical clinic and sent to ED for further evaluation.
26 2021-02-26 ringing in ears 1439 Patient states that she was looking at her phone and noticed an increased heart rate. Patient s... Read more
Close
1439 Patient states that she was looking at her phone and noticed an increased heart rate. Patient states that she could hear her heartbeat in her ears. Patient assessed. VItals BP 115/70, P 103, O2 97%, R 18. Alert and oriented x 4. Will monitor for 30 minutes. 1509 Vitals BP 115/68, P 97, O2 98%, R 16, alert and oriented x 4. Patient states that symptoms subsided. Patient discharged.

Close
My eyes began watering and began to burn. This lasted 5 minutes. It has happened two more times since I got the vaccine.
26 2021-03-03 vision blurred Patient found unresponsive in recovery area at 6pm. Patient skin color gray, cool, unresponsive, no... Read more
Close
Patient found unresponsive in recovery area at 6pm. Patient skin color gray, cool, unresponsive, no pulse noted by writer. Writer sternal rubbed patient and called name multiple times. Staff arrived to assist and writer sent one to call 911 and one staff member to get wheelchair to tranport patient to recovery area. While waiting for wheelchair after about 2 minutes patient regained consciousness, but still gray and not fully responsive. Patient stated she could see me but vision very blurry. Writer and LPN tranported patient to recovery and took vitals. Patient awake at this time. VS 110/80, 95%SpO2, pulse 76 at 6:06pm. Recheck of BP 132/110 at 6:14pm. Patient skin PWD. EMT's arrived assessed patient, took EKG-WNL, VSS stable, BP slightly elevated. EMT's offered to transport patient via amb to ER, patient declined. Writer released patient to boyfriend to drive her home.

26 2021-03-21 mouth tingling tingling in her mouth and lips; lump in throat; dizziness; tunnel vision; shaking; headache; anaphyl... Read more
Close
tingling in her mouth and lips; lump in throat; dizziness; tunnel vision; shaking; headache; anaphylaxis; A spontaneous report was received from a physician concerning a 26-year-old female patient who received Moderna (mRNA-1273) vaccine and experienced Anaphylactic reaction, having tingling in patient's mouth and lips and a lump in their throat, very bad headache, dizziness, tunnel vision and shakiness. The patient's medical history included: allergy to azithromycin and penicillin. Concomitant product use was not provided by the reporter. On 19 Feb 2021, approximately four minutes prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch number: 031L20A) for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 19 Feb 2021 at 14.09, the patient had tingling in their mouth and lips and a lump in their throat. The patient's heart rate noted was 130s. The patient also reported very bad headache dizziness and tunnel vision. The patient developed shakiness which was noted on exam. The reporter reported for an anaphylaxis reaction . The patient's Blood pressure reported was 156/80. At 14.29, the patient's Blood pressure reported was 176/87. Treatment information provided included EpiPen (0.3mg) given Intramuscularly to right thigh at 14.22 and supplemental O2 provided. The reporter stated ambulance was called, husband of the patient was called. Reports were given to ambulance services. The systolic BP upon transport was 168. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the event(s) was Not applicable. On 19 Feb 2021, the outcome of the events, having tingling in patient's mouth and lips and a lump in their throat, very bad headache, dizziness and tunnel vision were considered resolved and the outcome of the event, shakiness was considered not resolved. On an unknown date, the outcome of the event, Anaphylactic reaction was considered unknown.; Reporter's Comments: Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the se events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

On 24-DEC-2020, the patient experienced shoulder pain at injection site, chills and fever that evening. On 25-DEC-2020, the right arm was still hurting. On 26-DEC-2020, she had dizziness, a dull headache felt cross eyed and felt that she couldn't function properly. The headache increased intensity making her to go to the hospital on 01-JAN-2021. She felt like she was going to pass out. Information about whether or not she was admitted was not provided. Laboratory reports were not provided. 28 2021-01-08 lip swelling Received vaccine on 12/31/2020, developed mild arm pain following day at injection site. On 1/05/202... Read more
Close
Received vaccine on 12/31/2020, developed mild arm pain following day at injection site. On 1/05/2021, developed mild lip swelling around 1630, that increased to hives on upper back and hips. At 2030, lip swelling had significantly increased and throat felt ?weird? and tight. Fiancé drove to Emergency Department, was deemed not necessary to have epinephrine at the time. Discharged with four day course of prednisone and famotidine. On 1/09/2021, returned to Emergency Department for bilateral hand swelling, increased hives on arms, back and sides. Epinephrine 0.3 mg administered IM right thigh, discharged with another script for prednisone. There were no other changes to lifestyle including lotions, body washes, perfumes, food, etc. that could have potentially triggers reaction.

Within the hour of the symptoms (noticed around 5:15pm) I started to have a rash on the left side of my neck, along with small red dots on my chest. My throat was tingling ajd I had what is best described as ?on and off? rushes throughout my body. I returned back to the site where I got my test from and reported my reaction somewhere around 5:30. I was given 50 mg of Benadryl and told to have friends come and pick me up and drive me home. Around 8pm I was having slight tingling in my throat however it was mentioned it could be the after effect of the sensitivity to the vaccine. I was advised to not have the second dose.

Close
12/31 I had tingling in my throat and was observed in urgent care for two hours with no intervention. It went away by the time I went to bed that night. 1/8 I woke up with a sore arm, did not think much of it and went to work. It was sore all day and when I got home I undressed to take a shower and noticed that it was red, swollen and hot to the touch. I tried hot compresses as I suspected it was cellulitis and marked the borders. It had grown in size the nest morning (1/9) which is when I went back to urgent care and was prescribed 3 days of Keflex. The first dose reduced the swelling and pain in my arm, but by the end of the course of antibiotics it was still red 1/13 I went back to urgent care to be seen for the redness and tenderness. The NP suspected that it may be an immune reaction rather than cellulitis and gave me a single oral dose of decadron with instructions to follow up in 3-4 hours by sending in a picture, and if it did not get better to fill a longer prescription for Keflex. At this point I have taken the prescription to the pharmacy and am waiting until after work to pick it up and begin the script.

I am a MD student who got the first dose of the moderna vaccine on 1/4/2021. I had no immediate reaction other than arm soreness. A couple weeks after my first vaccine, I had a reaction when drinking miralax. Within ~5 minutes of having a few sips of a 17g solution, I had throat tingling/tightening, sense of impending doom, cough, dyspnea, nausea, fecal urgency, and intense chills with shivering. I stopped drinking the solution and my symptoms eventually resolved on their own (the chills and nausea took the longest, about 1.5 hours) - I didn't even think to take benadryl because it wasn't clear to me at the time if I was really having an allergic reaction (no hives, no vomiting - but in retrospect I'm concerned). I've had miralax in the past without any issues. I've never had a vaccine adverse reaction. I have no history of atopy.

Close
I received my shot at 6:53pm. I went to the waiting room and waited until my time was up, I was released from my observation station at 7:11pm. Staff did ask me how I was feeling I had no signs or symptoms upon being released. I left the facility feeling great had no issues at all. I went to pick up my dinner at 7:45pm drove home. When I arrived home my lips started to tingle, and my face was starting to swell up. I inspected the rest of my body for any rash called my mom and read over the fact sheet that was given to me at time of shot. As per the directions regarding the risk of an allergic reaction I called my primary care doctor because my face was beginning to swell, and my throat started to feel scratchy. My primary care doctor called me back and advise I go to the ER immediately to be monitored for an allergic reaction. I arrived in a Hospital just before 9pm and checked in at the ER. The doctor saw me quickly. By the time the doctor saw me at the ER my face was bright red I had developed a rash all over my chest and back and on the injection site, my lips were swollen and had mild throat swelling. She gave me a high dose of prednisone and 2 Benadryl's. They continued to monitor me for a while until they felt better and discharged me with a epi pen and other meds.

28 2021-02-18 lip swelling Facial edema, oropharyngeal edema; Lip swelling; Throat itching; Tachycardia; A spontaneous report w... Read more
Close
Facial edema, oropharyngeal edema; Lip swelling; Throat itching; Tachycardia; A spontaneous report was received from a healthcare professional concerning a 28-year-old female, patient who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273) and developed lips swelling, throat itching, facial edema, and oropharyngeal edema. The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant product use was not reported. On 15 Jan 2021, approximately five minutes prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 intramuscularly in the arm for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 15 Jan 2021, five minutes after the vaccine was administered, at 11:15am, the patient complained of lip swelling and throat itching. A healthcare provider assessed the patient and vital signs included, pressure 132/103 mmHg, heart rate 95 beats per minute, and 100 percent oxygen saturation. At 11:22am, the patient had facial edema, oropharyngeal edema and attempted to clear her throat. Vital signs reported at that time included, blood pressure 143/106 mmHg, heart rate 121 beats per minute, and oxygen saturation 99 percent. Treatment for the event included diphenhydramine 50mg and epinephrine by injection twice. Emergency services were called to transport the patient, however, the patient declined transport. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was not reported. The outcome of the events, lip swelling, throat itching, facial edema, and oropharyngeal edema, was unknown.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 28 year-old, female patient, who experienced events of lips swelling, throat itching, facial edema, and oropharyngeal edema. The events occurred within minutes after the first and last dose of mRNA-1273 vaccine administration. Based on the current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the events, a causal relationship cannot be excluded and the events are assessed as possibly related.

Close
-Pain in right arm--none at time of injection, but developed over a few hours. By next morning, unable to lift full arm more than 6 inches without pain. Slept entire day of 23 Feb. Slept half of 24 Feb.

Jaw pain; Syncopal episode/Syncope; Fell; Dizziness; Nausea; Felt flu-like; Injection site pain; Fatigue; Headache; Muscle pain; Chills; Fever; Felt unwell; A spontaneous report was received from a nurse concerning a female 28 year old, patient who experienced same day injection site pain, fatigue, headache, muscle pain, chills, fever, felt unwell and flu-like. On 29/Jan/2021, she developed dizziness, nausea, a syncopal episode and fell and hit her jaw, which developed into pain. . The patient's medical history was not provided. Concomitant product use was unknown by the reporter. The patient received their second dose of mRNA-1273 lot 028L20A on 28-JAN-2021. On 28-JAN-2021 approximately 1 day prior to the onset of the symptoms, the patient received their second of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 Lot number 028L20A intramuscularly for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. A patient received her second dose of Moderna vaccine on 28/Jan/2021 at 8 AM, lot 028L20A. Same day at 17:00, she experienced injection site pain, fatigue, headache, muscle pain, chills, fever, felt unwell and flu-like. On 29/Jan/2021, she developed dizziness, nausea, a syncopal episode and fell and hit her jaw, which developed pain. She was seen in the emergency room (ER) and released with a diagnosis of syncope and jaw pain. Resolution dates not reported. Treatment information was not provided/unknown. The patient received both scheduled doses of mRNA-1273 prior to the event(s); therefore, action taken with the drug in response to the event(s) is not applicable.; Reporter's Comments: This report concerns a 28--year-old female who received Moderna's COVID-19 Vaccine (mRNA-1273), Lot # not provided, and within 2 days, experienced injection site pain, fatigue, headache, muscle pain, chills, fever, felt unwell and flu-like, dizziness, nausea, a syncopal episode and fell and hit her jaw, which developed into pain. Medical Director had advised her to see her PMD. At night, staff reported rash spread down to her pelvis area 3/3 Wed - Staff stated her eyes are swollen 3/4 Thur - Seen by doctor; labs drawn (staff unsure what labs), was prescribed: Benadryl 25mg 1 tab every 6hrs for 5 days, Claritin 10mg daily for 10 days, Clobetasol prop 0.05% cream

Patient has experienced continued shortness of breath, occasional palpitations, tinnitus, and swollen + blistered tongue since suspecting having COVID-19 in January 2020. Since her first dose of Moderna on March 11th, 2021, she has continued to experience some of the symptoms previously listed and stiffness/ soreness at injection site. She states the tinnitus is not as loud and bothersome as it was closer to time of vaccination and her arm is still sore to the touch. Pt stated she was unaware but at time of 1st injection she was pregnant, she is 10 weeks pregnant of today (4/13/21). Listed below are the side effects and length of event reported by the patient: "COVID tongue" (2hr, 13 days) Site soreness/stiffness (5hr, ongoing) Exhaustion (24hr, ~7 days) Neck stiffness (~24hr, 12 days) Tinnitus (~24hr, ongoing) After discussion with her OBGYN and the pharmacy team, we agreed for safety reasons, she not receive the second Moderna dose.

29 2021-01-12 taste impairment Notes Emergency Medicine Expand All Collapse All 1/13/2021 Date: 1/13/2021 ... Read more
Close
Notes Emergency Medicine Expand All Collapse All 1/13/2021 Date: 1/13/2021 Subjective 29 y.o. female who was seen at COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. She denied any history of previous adverse reactions to vaccines. She was given the Moderna vaccination in the left deltoid muscle. During her 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience metallic taste and then felt lightheadedness. She denied rash, hives, difficulty breathing, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, throat tightness, itching, facial swelling and lip swelling. This provider was notified of patient reaction and she was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms and worsening of symptoms. 9:53 AM On arrival to treatment room, patient is pale and diaphoretic. She states she feels very lightheaded. She is able to answer questions, but is easily wanting to fall asleep. She awakes easily to verbal stimuli, states she feels very tired. Denies shortness of breath, throat swelling, difficulty breathing, rash. Reports she ate cereal for breakfast. 10:05 AM Patient is more alert and no longer diaphoretic. She is alert and states she is feeling better. Will continue to monitor. 10:12 AM Patient is alert and texting on her phone. Vital signs have improved. 10:19 AM Patient is alert and oriented and continues to do well. She states she is feeling much better. No diaphoresis noted. States she still has a little bit of a metallic taste in her mouth, but otherwise denies any other symptoms. Vital signs continue to improve. 10:36 AM Patient continues to do well. Is drinking water and ate granola bar. Continues to feel well and reports metallic taste in improving and denies any other symptoms. 10:58 AM Patient continues to be alert and oriented. No longer pale and diaphoretic. States she is feeling well and back to baseline. Denies any complaints. Vital signs remain stable. She is able to ambulate with steady gait and denies dizziness/lightheaded with ambulation. Denies chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, vomiting, difficulty breathing. 11:06 AM Patient's friend here to drive her home. She is ambulatory to the car and continues to feel well and denies symptoms. Discussed return precautions. Patient voiced understanding and denies any questions. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient denies facial swelling, puffy eyes, chest tightness, shortness of breath, rash, hives, itching of skin and vomiting Metallic taste in mouth: Diaphoresis : lightheaded: Previous Reactions: None Objective Vitals Vitals: 01/13/21 1033 01/13/21 1042 01/13/21 1057 01/13/21 1104 BP: 129/87 128/77 122/78 132/72 Pulse: 63 66 58 58 SpO2: 100% 100% 100% 100% Blood Sugar 98 collected at 10:00 AM Physical Exam Vitals signs and nursing note reviewed. Constitutional: Appearance: She is diaphoretic. HENT: Mouth/Throat: Pharynx: Oropharynx is clear. Uvula midline. No pharyngeal swelling, oropharyngeal exudate, posterior oropharyngeal erythema or uvula swelling. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Regular rhythm. Bradycardia present. Heart sounds: Normal heart sounds. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. No tachypnea, bradypnea, accessory muscle usage or respiratory distress. Breath sounds: Normal breath sounds. Skin: Coloration: Skin is pale. Comments: Diaphoretic and pale Neurological: Comments: Alert and able to answer questions, but wanting to fall asleep. Easily awakes to verbal stimuli. Moving all extremities and following commands. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: Given water to drink and monitored. Follow up response to treatment: excellent. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Friend is going to drive her home. Electronically Signed 1/13/2021 11:07 AM

29 2021-01-20 oropharyngeal discomfort 48 hours notices bumps in the rear of tongue, did not affect swallowing or breathing however, over t... Read more
Close
48 hours notices bumps in the rear of tongue, did not affect swallowing or breathing however, over time they did get larger. By 96 hours after vaccination, there was an uncomfortable feeling in my throat as I was breathing which lasted consistently for about 24 hours. Which in that time, I was able to get into contact with health care professionals (Dentist and Ear Nose Throat Dr. ) Who suggested Benadryl, contact PCP, and make sure to have EPI pen. After taking benadryl for 12 hours, it seemed to have gone down. 6 days after vaccine (day 5 was a holiday), I was able to have a TeleMed appointment with a PA, spoke with my PCP. Day 8 I was able to see my doctor who confirmed it was an allergic reaction and prescribed a steroid to help my throat/tongue to continue to go back.

Close
I received the vaccine on 1/19/2021 at my place of employment. Upon getting the vaccine approx 30 minutes after receiving i became very itcy, and my lips were burning/tingling. The itching continued to get worse, forming red rash on my chest. I called my MD at this point. I was told to take benadryl and to go to er if it became worse. I took benadryl. the itching continued for 2 days. i also experienced pain at injection site, headache, nausea, diarrhea, extreme fatigue, muscle soreness. on 2nd day after vaccine i woke up and my muscles continued to be very sore. like i had just completed a marathon. I also have this sensation that started with the increased muscle pain. The only way i can explain it is that it feels like how a TENS unit feels, but its coming from the inside. especially in my back and thighs. this continues. i feel like i could just start shaking at any time. i cannot sleep but i am so tired. i was seen at dr today and i was told to report this to you guys. this sensation has not went away and has actually cause my muscles to spasming. MD said the vaccine effected my muscles and possibly neurologically as well.

29 2021-01-23 sensitivity to light Beginning when I woke up the following morning, I had a very severe headache. It lasted all day unti... Read more
Close
Beginning when I woke up the following morning, I had a very severe headache. It lasted all day until I went to sleep. Figured it was from the vaccine and would be gone the next day. It was still there when I woke up again... and the severe headache and extreme light sensitivity in my eyes lasted for 20 straight days. It kept me from being able to work fully and had to cancel many of my client bookings. I had 2 days of no headaches- felt great- Jan 21st and 22nd. Then again through today it has been there. I can?t describe it very well as it feels like it?s all over and the pain is almost unbearable at times. Even when the headache is lessened/subdued by darkness or ibuprofen, I still feel it strongly in my left temple/behind left eye at all times. I haven?t experienced headaches like this ever before in my life, even though I?ve had random headaches here and there in the past. They have never been there when I wake up in the AM though and sleep has always made them go away previously. Although I can?t imagine this is specifically from the vaccine, it also seems like the timing is so related that I was advised to file a report here.
29 2021-01-24 dry throat, dry mouth, mouth numbness The reason I came to this site to fill out adverse events is for lower right lip numbness that start... Read more
Close
The reason I came to this site to fill out adverse events is for lower right lip numbness that started about 30 hours after the shot, but I also did have other side effects starting the first day that I will list as well. I have never experienced anything like this numbness before in my life, and I am 99% positive it is due to receiving the Moderna vaccine. I did not find facial numbness as a possible side effect of the vaccine listed, so I searched ?facial numbness COVID vaccine? and was able to find that only 4 of the 30,000 participants in the Moderna trials experienced facial numbness, and that only 3/4 received that active vaccine over the placebo, and so was not considered to be a side effect of the vaccine. I also read that they appeared to be cases of Bell?s Palsey, which I do not believe to be what I am experiencing, because I do not seem to have any symptoms of drooping, just a numb sensation. I woke up around 4:30AM on Wednesday (got vaccine on Monday at 2:30pm) with my lower right lip completely numb. The lower left lip had full feeling, as did my entire upper lip. Friday afternoon (2 days later on the 15th) I finally started to get some feeling back on the inside on my lower right lip. Over the next week (it?s been 12 days now since I first woke up with my lip numb), I have slowly regained a little more sensation each day. While I have about 95% of my feeling/sensation back in my lower right lip, there is still some numbness. Also important to note that while this symptom has been annoying, it has not been painful in any way. An adverse side effect that happened immediately after getting the vaccccine was that my arm started to itch around the injection site, spanning about 3 inches out in every direction. My arm also got very slightly puffy (only right at the injection site), and moderately pink/red in the same area. They kept me just a little longer than the 15 minutes, but I had no breathing issues, and stated that I felt fine, and was able to leave. Adverse side effects that started day one of getting the vaccine and lasted 2-3 days: -Severe cotton mouth/dry mouth and throat that started on my drive home about 40 minutes after receiving the injection -Severe fatigue that started about 2 hours after receiving the vaccine (could not even keep eyes open the first day, and had to call out of work for the next two days) -Moderately severe arm numbness at the site of injection that I noticed around 6 hours after injection. This symptom bothered me less than others due to lifelong chronic pain, but it was still very difficult to raise my arm to grab things (moved slow like a sloth to be able to push past the soreness).

1/12/21 received the vaccine and had mild symptoms of injection site pain and LGF. By morning of 1/13/21, c/o fever up to 103.4, joint pain, especially in spine, dry heaves/nausea, dizziness and metallic tastes. Symptoms resolved within 2 days.

29 2021-01-27 mouth tingling At 07:30 patient approached this writer and stated he was feeling lightheaded and sweaty and felt as... Read more
Close
At 07:30 patient approached this writer and stated he was feeling lightheaded and sweaty and felt as though she may faint. This writer instructed her to sit down. This writer then requested assistance from RN. As RN approached where patient was sitting, patient stated "yeah I'm going to faint" she then fell forward from her chair onto the floor, with the top of her head hitting the floor first. RN instructed staff to call the Rapid Response Team who was unavailable. This writer gathered the anaphylaxis/reaction supplies that were on hand. Patient's body postured and at that time RN rolled her onto her side. Patient quickly regained consciousness. Vitals were taken and stable. Patient was given the opportunity to be seen in the ED multiple times but she declined. She stated that her lips felt "tingly" and was given 50mg/20mL Diphenhydramine oral solution. She remained in the COVID vaccination clinic at Medical Center for observation for 40 minutes, at which time her husband retrieved her and escorted her home.

29 2021-02-02 eye swelling 3-4 minutes after receiving injection patient's caregiver noticed some swelling of patient's left ey... Read more
Close
3-4 minutes after receiving injection patient's caregiver noticed some swelling of patient's left eye. Patient did not complain of any shortness of breath, itching, hives, etc. BP and pulse ox were normal, but some wheezing was noted by a physician in the vaccine clinic. Patient was transferred to our ED for further evaluation. The ED did not hear any wheezing, and the patient's caregiver said that the swelling of her eye appeared to lessen. She was treated in the ED with IV Benadryl, Solu-Medrol, and Pepcid. Was discharged approximately 2 hours later.

29 2021-02-10 vision blurred Within 13 minutes of having the vaccine client stated that she was having blurred vision. The build... Read more
Close
Within 13 minutes of having the vaccine client stated that she was having blurred vision. The building where vaccines were given was 75 degrees that morning the client was bundled up with a winter hat, coat, sweatshirt, and gloves. When she first stated she wasn't feeling good we had her remove all her outwear so she could cool off, she immediately began trembling uncontrollably. Vitals were taken 144/78, pulse 125, 4 minutes later 136/74 pulse 100, 5 minutes later 130/82 pulse 80. During this time client continued to tremble. She voiced her anxiety for getting shots and also states she hadn't even anything yet that day. She was given 2 large glasses of water which she drank both of them . By 11:00 am she was no longer having any symptoms.

Within 5 minutes after 1st dose I became dizzy and hot. This went away after 30 minutes. This continued each day for a week. I?m dec 29 I was treated for Bell?s palsy. My face was numb on the right side, later progressed to my entire right side of my body. A few days later I wasn?t able to get out of bed I was extremely weak, fatigue. Had a hard time walking. Went to the er on January 3rd. Treated for migraine with paresthesia. Continued to have vertigo, numbness, weakness, fatigue. Also, had anxiety and panic attacks. Vision is now blurry, a s constantly seeing floaters. Also, I now have issues with fluid in my ear that won?t go away.

3/2/2021 10:45 - got vaccine Instantaneously burning and shooting pain starting at injection point and radiating down arm and up arm to my upper back/neck 10:50 - tingling sensation around and in mouth 11:00 - Left observation area and went home 11:30 - burning sensation getting worse in arm 12:00 PM - throat beginning to tingle and harder to swallow 2:00 - one hive formed on right side of face, one behind right ear, and one on my labia. Throat tingling more and harder to swallow. Throat is much more red from what I could see. My Mother noticed my eyes getting puffy. 3:00 - shooting/burning pain in arm subsiding 4:30 - throat tingling subsiding 4:35 - arm soreness (which I expected) 5:00 - severe nausea and abdominal cramps. Had to sit in bathroom in case I threw up. Took Dramamine 6:00 - nausea and abdominal cramps gone. Most all symptoms are gone 10:00 - took Benadryl (only time I took it) and went to sleep 3/3/2021 8:00 - arm is too sore to move up and down 11:30 - fever starting (my normal baseline is 97 and my temperature was at 99 F at this point) 12:00 - fever to 100 and overall body aches (was expecting) 1:30 - took Tylenol 2:00 - fever and body aches subsiding 9:00 - beyond arm soreness, no other symptoms

Close
Day of: Hydrated pre-vaccination. Soreness at injection site onset approx. 3 hours after vaccination and has lasted a few days. Refrained from massaging muscle or sleeping on that side. At approx. 5-6 hours post-vaccination, aches and chills onset. No fever throughout the evening. Nausea onset approx. 7-8 hours post-vaccination. Took 1,000mg of NSAID containing acetaminophen and went to bed @9pm to try to sleep it off. Day after: Woke up at 12:15am and 12:45am vomiting. Continued to have aches, chills, and fever (ranging from 99.9? to 101.5?) throughout the day. Took 1,000mg of fast acting Tylenol in the afternoon, drank fluids and rested. Two days after: Woke up @8:30am and felt faint (whistling in ears as well) for approx. 20 minutes. Continued to feel fatigued and weak throughout the day but fever and chills subsided.

30 2021-01-03 vision blurred A week after receiving the COVD19 vaccine, red patches of skin started appearing around the injectio... Read more
Close
A week after receiving the COVD19 vaccine, red patches of skin started appearing around the injection site. Patches were not itchy. Armpit area (lymph nodes) was painful, as well as general pain in left arm. The next day the rash had gotten larger and left arm started tingling. Arm pain persisted. On the third day the rash was larger still, with prolonged arm tingling and left chest area pain. I went to the ER as no one could answer why these problems were arising a week after the vaccine. ER advised taking Benadryl and watching out for shortness of breath. Arm is currently tingling and eyesight seems fuzzy.

After 15 min from receiving vaccine I started feeling tightness in my throat, chest and my mouth , the nurse were walking around so I told the nurse I could not breath and the nurse told the doctor and the doctor looked into my mouth and saw my mouth and throat were swelling. I was taken into a clinic room and given a epi shot and another one less then ten mins. both given to left thigh . Along with oxygen. Ambulance came and given Benadryl and started and IV. they took me to the hospital. once I was at the hospital I was given a shot of prednisone and had a fast HR, was released 3 hours later (1/7/21) Was given RX by the ER doctor. Still have a sore throat, my tonsils are really really bright red , my tongue is still a little swollen with red dots and a tingle feeling.

Close
Tachycardia Narrative: Pt. received the Moderna COVID-19 vaccination at 1030. At 1040 pt. altered staff and stated that she felt like her heart was beating too fast. and that the back of her tongue felt tingly. Vitals were taken and found HR 130 bpm and SpO2 100% on RA, temp 99.1, BP 117/90. On site provider was notified and prescribed Benadry 50mg PO. Pt. was monitored for an additional 30 minutes. VS at 1100 were BP 116/85, HR 112, SpO2 99%. Sent to ED for observation until symptoms resolve.

30 2021-01-10 taste impairment, lip swelling, swollen tongue Approximately 5 minutes after receiving the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine in my left deltoid, my mouth fe... Read more
Close
Approximately 5 minutes after receiving the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine in my left deltoid, my mouth felt prickly and tasted metallic, my lips and tongue turned red and slightly swollen, along with swelling in my throat. After about 30 minutes the oral sensations improved, but my throat tightness increased. With some difficulty I swallowed a 25 mg capsule of diphenhydramine. Fifteen minutes after ingesting the capsule, the esophageal swelling improved slightly. Over the next 18 hours I continued taking 50 mg diphenhydramine every 4-6 hours. On 12/31/20 I no longer experienced any oral/esophageal swelling or abnormal sensations. However on 12/31/20 I developed severe pain and swelling at the injection site, extending to the left shoulder, head and neck, along with profound fatigue and full body myalgias and arthralgias, lasting through 1/3/21. I felt well January 4-6. However, on the evening of 1/6/21 I again developed severe pain and swelling at the injection site, extending to the left shoulder, head and neck, along with profound fatigue and full body myalgias and arthralgias, persisting until 1/9/21. On 1/8/21 I additionally experienced pruritis and erythema on my left deltoid, this resolved spontaneously on 1/10/21.

chest tightness with inspiration, throat tingling, scratchy throat. no labored breathing, no tongue or lip swelling. she notes also right leg hurts but able to stand and walk on leg with improvement. Monitored with stable VS. O2 Sats at 100% and non labored breathing. Given total of 50 mg Benadryl and monitored for total of 45 minutes from exam time and she was taken home by family member and given ED precautions.

30 2021-01-14 swollen tongue 30 y.o. female who was seen at a COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vacci... Read more
Close
30 y.o. female who was seen at a COVID Vaccine Clinic today for her first dose of the COVID 19 vaccination. She denied any history of previous adverse reactions to vaccines. She was given the Moderna vaccination in the left deltoid muscle. During her 15 minute waiting period after the injection, the patient began to experience Right arm pain, numbness/tingling and soreness, note that injection was given in left arm. She denied rash, hives, welts, difficulty breathing, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, throat tightness, hoarseness, stridor, itching, lightheadedness, dizziness, facial swelling, lip swelling and tongue swelling. This provider was notified of patient reaction and she was then assessed in the emergency bay area. Monitored patient for severe reaction symptoms, including but not limited to abdominal pain, blood pressure abnormality , chest pain, collapse, drooling, hypotension, increased swelling, rapid progression of symptoms, respiratory distress, skin changes, tongue swelling and vomiting. ALLERGY REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Patient complains of muscle aches (Right arm) Previous Reactions: No previous reactions to vaccines. Objective Vitals Vitals: 01/15/21 1239 01/15/21 1248 BP: 137/89 134/89 Pulse: 99 100 SpO2: 100% 100% Blood Sugar 66 collected at 1236 * Patient given snack (granola bar) just before blood glucose checked. Physical Exam Constitutional: General: She is not in acute distress. Appearance: Normal appearance. She is not ill-appearing. Cardiovascular: Rate and Rhythm: Normal rate. Pulmonary: Effort: Pulmonary effort is normal. No respiratory distress. Musculoskeletal: Right shoulder: She exhibits pain. She exhibits normal range of motion and no tenderness. Right elbow: She exhibits normal range of motion and no swelling. No tenderness found. Right wrist: She exhibits normal range of motion and no tenderness. Skin: General: Skin is warm and dry. Neurological: Mental Status: She is alert and oriented to person, place, and time. Assessment/Plan Treatment included: Ibuprofen/analgesics. Follow up response to treatment: no change. Patient discharge: Stable to go home and follow up with PCP. Reports that she had work up for Guillain Barre 2.5 years ago but this was ruled out. States that she has had intermittent pain of all extremities since that time and has a handicap parking placard due to this. She denies any pain in right arm prior to the vaccine but states it started just a few minutes after administration. She has full ROM without difficulty and full sensation but reports some numbness and tingling as well as soreness but not necessarily tender to touch. Ibuprofen was administered but shortly after patient requesting to leave and feels this pain is the same as what she's had over the past 2.5 years but wanted to keep us aware. She will be discharging home and states she does not live alone.
30 2021-01-16 mouth tingling Day 0 (day of shot): No symptoms at all Day 1: Knot and redness at injection site Day 2: Knot got la... Read more
Close
Day 0 (day of shot): No symptoms at all Day 1: Knot and redness at injection site Day 2: Knot got larger Day 3: Knot started getting smaller in size but began itching, also began to bruise Day 4: Knot is gone but injection site is itchy, left outer corner of bottom lip tingly, right armpit sore (2/10 pain) but no adenopathy Day 5: Welt formed at injection site - itchy, no more tingling in lip, armpit hurts more (4/10 pain) Day 6: woke up with welt on right shin, scratched in PM and welt got larger, welt still present at injection site, axillary node swollen right armpit Day 7: same symptoms from day 6 so went to health clinic and told to report symptoms and use cortisone cream on welts and take tylenol for pain - told to go to ER if symptoms got worse, got CBC labs done, in the evening noticed new welt next to left elbow and left knee - both itchy Day 8: day 7 symptoms plus woke up with knot on back of left hand that made abducting fingers and extending wrist painful (5/10 pain) and welt on right shin (still very itchy) was very large and hard, went to ER and was given benadryl shot and salumedrol shot (both IM), while at ER - another knot formed in palm of left hand so had hand xray - normal, got results from CBC from day 7 - levels within normal range, discharged with script for 7 days of prednisone and immobilization brace for left hand for 4 days, told can take 50 mg benadryl OTC as directed Day 9: left hand swelling decreased, itching mostly subsided, welts are improving, recovering but welts still present

30 2021-01-18 bloodshot eyes, eye swelling I received the vaccination on 1/14 and started to get an itching sensation that night - nothing noti... Read more
Close
I received the vaccination on 1/14 and started to get an itching sensation that night - nothing noticeably or concern and was able to go to sleep. The next morning I was very itchy and red and started to break out in hives that started to get worse and spread through my body. I took Benadryl throughout the day and at night to help my sleep. On Saturday morning my eyes were swollen and red, I had severe hives all over my body and had to go to the ER for some type of relief. This was immediately after I woke up, the right side of my body was extremely hot and I went to the restroom and looked in the mirror and didn't recognize myself. At the ER, they put me on Prednisone - to take 2 tablets for 3 days, Famotidine - taking 1 tab, 2 times a day for 5 days, and Benadryl, 1 tab, 3X a day until the symptoms subside - It is currently 1/19 and my skin will start to heat up, primarily in my hands and start to itch, but no more hives or anything severe. I am currently pregnant with my first child, due date 7/7/2021. I have had no previous pregnancies, miscarriages, or abortions.

Right after receiving the vaccine waiting my 15 minutes it felt tingling and burning sensation from my shoulder across my clavicle bone towards my heart. First 5 day (Tuesday-Sunday) symptoms: swollen, sore, red, & bruised arm at injection spot; body aches, joint pain of knees, fatigue, no energy, loss of appetite, dry mouth, headache, chills, nausea. I felt better on the 6th day (Sunday), the injection site looked like it was healing and going back to normal on my shoulder. Then on 7th day (Monday) my injection spot started to itch and break out in a huge hive and little hives around it. It turned into a bright red circle around the injection spot. It was hot to touch and very swollen. On 8th to current day (11th) my arm keeps getting worse with the swelling, hotness, itching, & redness, and spreading down my arm.

30 2021-01-29 visual impairment About 30 mins after receiving the vaccine I developed a strong headache while driving that affected ... Read more
Close
About 30 mins after receiving the vaccine I developed a strong headache while driving that affected my vision. Later that evening I got a stomach ache, the chills/hot flashes, arm soreness and the shakes. Most lasted until the following morning when I got up at 6:15am for work. The following morning I was only experiencing shakiness and arm soreness. About a week in a half later, I developed a rash at the injection site that looked like two large red blobs. The rash was slightly itchy and lasted only a couple of days.
30 2021-01-29 loss of smell, taste impairment Patient received the 1st dose of Moderna vaccine on 12/28/20. The next day, on 12/29/20, she develo... Read more
Close
Patient received the 1st dose of Moderna vaccine on 12/28/20. The next day, on 12/29/20, she developed a fever >100, fatigue, chills, sore throat, new anosmia/dysgeusia, chest tightness, headache, GI symptoms, and nasal congestion. When the symptoms did not resolve, she contacted her doctor on 1/2/21. They referred her to get a COVID test and that test from 1/2/21 returned positive. Follow-up on 1/4 showed symptoms stable. No hospitalization required. Treated with albuterol inhaler and pseudoephedrine. Not believed to be related to vaccine, however reporting since my understanding is that VAERs is interested in reports of positive COVID cases following vaccination.

Vital signs taken two times, cough not subsiding and breathing becoming more difficult for patient. EMTs evaluated and placed on supplemental oxygen for comfort. [Tuesday 11:35 AM] 09:45 Second dose Moderna vaccine lot number 007M20A exp 7/2021 given at vaccine clinic. 10:00 Pt reports feeling light headed, dizzy, pt walked a few steps with supervision to stretcher. Vitals remain stable though hypertensive at 148/90. 10:20 BP 128/97 HR 92 Reports tingling to roof of mouth. Observed baseline oral exam due to pt past report of anaphylaxis in the setting of allergy shot, oral exam appears normal, pink mucosa, no swelling. Will continue to monitor on stretcher. Pt drinking water without any problems and does not appear in distress. 10:35 Noted hoarse voice, re-examined oral mucosa and patient's tongue, palate and, uvula now appears flushed, red and slightly but noticeably swollen, face is also now flushed. Lips appear same size and not swollen. Called RRT immediately. Advised transfer to ED. Pt remains in no distress. 10:40 RRT arrives to vaccine clinic in auditorium, gave report to RRT, reexamined oral mucosa which appears the same as 10:35 assessment (lightly but noticeably red, swollen tongue, palate and uvula). Face remains flushed as documented at 10:35. BP 128/90 HR 89. 10:45 Pt en route to ED with RT at bedside in no apparent distress.

A presure in my head, worse with standing up, and it made me dizzy when I stood up. On the night of 2/18/21 I developed left sided ear pain. On 2/19/21 I developed a left sided otitis media. On 2/21/21 I developed sudden onset left sided facial droop. I had a negative head CT, and was diagnosed with bells palsy related to the swelling in my ear from the otitis media. I continue to have significant ear pain, and left sided facial paralysis today.

Immediate experience of hot flushes and chills with severe nausea. Chest felt tight, upper stomach in extreme discomfort, Hard to see, lights hurting eyes, seeing spots in the air. Sound became amplified and began to experience a migraine. "People talking low to me felt like they were screaming into my ear drums." Extreme fatigue so could barely keep eyes open. Standing was difficult; moved to wheelchair. Most symptoms lasted 2 to 3 days. Fever of 102 on first day only. Fatigue for one week. Right upper arm, not at the injection site, had a "hive" about the size of a nickel that has not gone away (as of 2/23/21). New migraines with light sensitivity that affect ability to work also have not gone away (as of 2/23/21).

12 hours after the vaccine administration, temperature started going up. At 22:00, temperature was 100.6F. Took 1tablet of acetaminophen 325mg and 25mg diphenhydramine. At 01:00, Fever went up to 101.8 F. Body started aching, persistent pain at right and left ribs that come and goes. Headache especially behind the right ear that also comes and goes (felt like a stabbing pain). Pulse was consistently over 100. The next day, temperature went down to 99F. The sharp, stabbing pain that comes and goes behind the right ear is still there for the next 2 days. Relieved by taking ibuprofen. The pain comes very sudden, it makes me flinch and unable to hold anything still on the right hand. 2/26/21, woke up at 06:00 with a sharp, throbbing pain on the right ear. Relieved by ibuprofen.

30 2021-02-26 vision blurred Patient states approximately 5 minutes after her vaccination, she started to feel like her vision wa... Read more
Close
Patient states approximately 5 minutes after her vaccination, she started to feel like her vision was slightly blurry, then experienced tunnel vision. Pt states felt almost like an "out of body" experience, but she did feel pressure to the left side of her head as she fell off of her chair and her head hit the floor. This fall was witnessed by another patient, who flagged the medical staff for help. A medical assistant notified me of the incident and I went to examine the patient, who was sitting on the floor, alert and conscious. I asked the staff to get the patient an ice pack, which was placed to patient's forehead and back of neck, and glass of water. Patient is able to swallow. A&O x 3, HR 81 and O2 sat 98% on room air. EOMI, PERRLA. Auscultation of heart & lungs was normal. No bony step-offs palpated. No tenderness upon palpation to patient's head, face and neck/c-spine. No visible contusions, abrasions noted. Normal ROM of all extremities and normal sensation. Observed patient over the course of 15 minutes and patient states she is feeling much better.

30 2021-03-11 mouth tingling, dry mouth, mouth numbness Immediately after injection, arm felt some tingling that subsided. Within 10 minutes of receiving th... Read more
Close
Immediately after injection, arm felt some tingling that subsided. Within 10 minutes of receiving the vaccine, my throat began to feel tight with my tongue feeling a heaviness. I experienced some difficulty swallowing and my heart began to race. Swelling did not worsen but face became flushed and entire mouth had a stinging/numbness. Took 25mg benadryl and 20 mg Pepcid about 25 minutes after vaccine and swelling is improved. Still some residual flushed feeling in my face and tongue still feels weird but am swallowing okay despite some dry mouth.

30 2021-03-24 lip swelling, eye swelling Patient states on day of vaccination she took 400 mg of ibuprofen due to the pain in her left should... Read more
Close
Patient states on day of vaccination she took 400 mg of ibuprofen due to the pain in her left shoulder around the injection site. Patient then woke up the next day (03/13/2021) and noticed that all of her fingers were more swollen than normal. Throughout the day, the patient reports that her finger swelling resolved and did have some facial swelling. 4 days later on 03/17/2021 the patient developed 3 pustules on her left shoulder at the injection site and another on her right scapula. The following day (03/18/2021), the patient began to have swelling around her eyes and lips. She saw her PCP that same day and was prescribed prednisone, Zyrtec, and hydroxyzine; however, the patient continued to develop mild pustules throughout her body. She presented to the ED on 3/19/2021 for evaluation. The patient was given 10 mg of dexamethasone and recommended to switch to benadryl. After discharge from ED, patient reports that her rash has continued to worsen as it is spreading diffusely all throughout her body. Patient specifically states that her rash spread from her left arm into her chest, then to her back, groin, face, and lower extremities. On 03/21/2021, patient reports that her pustules advanced into target lesions around her face along with developing some lesions in her mouth, as well. Patient also notes that her skin "burns" whenever she itches it. Patient then went in to be evaluated by a dermatologist and was sent to the ED for admission to the hospital. Patient currently hospitalized and undergoing work-up/treatment. Current treatment includes oral anti-histamine, analgesics, topical steroid, and IV fluids.
30 2021-04-02 visual impairment, ringing in ears Looked awful; Almost passed out; Vision was gone; Ringing in the ears; Clammy; Dizziness; Severe fat... Read more
Close
Looked awful; Almost passed out; Vision was gone; Ringing in the ears; Clammy; Dizziness; Severe fatigue; Low grade fever; A spontaneous report was received from a consumer concerning for herself, a 30-year-old, female patient, who received Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine (mRNA-1273) and experienced almost passed out/ Loss of consciousness, low grade fever/ Pyrexia, severe fatigue, dizziness, vision was gone/ Visual impairment, ringing in years/ Tinnitus, clammy/Cold sweat, Looked awful/ Feeling abnormal. The patient's medical history included she had undergone 2 open heart surgery and was on blood thinners. Concomitant medications include blood thinners. On 18Mar2021, prior to the onset of the events, the patient received their first of two planned doses of mRNA-1273 (Batch/Lot number: 037A21B) via an unknown route for prophylaxis of COVID-19 infection. On 18Mar2021, patient felt low grade fever. On 19Mar2021, patient had severe fatigue, dizziness and both were ongoing. On 20Mar2021 the patient stated that she almost passed out, my vision was gone, ringing in the ears and clammy (lasted 20 mins). On 22MAR2021 the patient was sent home from work because she looked awful. The event almost passed out was considered as medically significant. Treatment for the events was unknown. Action taken with mRNA-1273 in response to the events was Unknown. The outcome of the event low grade fever was resolved on 18Mar2021.The outcome of the events, almost passed out, vision was gone, ringing in years and clammy, were resolved on 20Mar2021. The outcome of events severe fatigue, dizziness was not recovered. The outcome of the event Looked awful was unknown, at the time of this report.; Reporter's Comments: This case concerns a 30 Y/O F with PMH cardiac surgery, had a serious unexpected event of loss of consciousness and nonserious unexpected dizziness, feeling abnormal, tinnitus, cold sweat, visual impairment and expected pyrexia and fatigue. Event onset Day 5 after first dose mRNA-1273. Based on current available information and temporal association between the use of the product and the start date of the event, a causal relationship cannot be excluded.

Close
Patient (self) woke up the day after the vaccination with a light-sensitive migraine that lasted from 8am until approximately 10pm the same day. After the migraine resolved, patient experienced extreme anxiety (likely panic attack) accompanying by uncontrollable shaking of both legs and loud crying producing tears. Prescription medications were taken on schedule, but the vaccination event may have triggered breakthrough anxiety and/or feeling of helplessness ~36 hours after vaccine received.

36 hours after vaccination I woke up at 3:15am with severe abdominal cramping, dizziness, excessive thirst, and nausea. The area around the injection site was swollen, red, and painful to touch. I fell over on my way to the toilet due to extreme dizziness. I had three hours of diarrhea, and then took pepto bismal and bennydryl. Those remedies worked and my symptoms subsided and I was able to fall back asleep by 4am. In the morning I felt normal, besides some remaining pain and redness surrounding the injection site.

31 2021-01-18 eye irritation Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine: Symptoms after vaccination: Intense pain to my affected arm started around... Read more
Close
Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine: Symptoms after vaccination: Intense pain to my affected arm started around 5-6:00pm the day I received the vaccine. A little while after that I noted terrible body aches and intense chills. I took Meloxicam and Tylenol for the pain to my arm and the body aches. This helped a little. I ended up going to bed at 7:00pm (same date) due to not feeling well. The chills were pretty intense going up and down my spine and I could not get comfortable in bed or sleep because I was freezing and aching all over. I am not sure if I had a fever at the time because I felt so weak and chilled that I couldn't get out of bed but my eyes felt like they were burning. My husband said I was sweating and my skin was burning hot despite the fact that I felt extremely cold. I developed a headache around midnight that lasted until the afternoon the day after my vaccination. I took more tylenol , meloxicam, and benadryl for the pain/headache and I took a mid morning nap. I felt better and more myself by about 4:00pm the next day. I did not need to receive any medical attention for these symptoms.

31 2021-01-20 swollen tongue, dry mouth, taste impairment Patient had an appointment for her first Covid vaccination today at 10:30am. Pt came in feeling fine... Read more
Close
Patient had an appointment for her first Covid vaccination today at 10:30am. Pt came in feeling fine but anxious about getting her vaccination. Pt also mentioned to both intern and I that she is a hypochondriac. She got her IM vaccination and sat down for 15 minutes as we monitored her. After her 15 minutes of sitting down in pharmacy area and being monitored by our intern and pharmacist, they asked how she's doing. Pt expressed she felt fine but had a dry mouth, and the intern told her to call 911 immediately if any shortness of breath occurred, but patient felt fine and left. About 25 minutes later she returned and expressed that she had a metallic taste in her mouth and was anxious about the shot. We asked her to sit down so we can monitor her further and she did. Five minutes later she expressed tongue swollen a little and a little difficulty swallowing but had no trouble breathing. At that time pharmacy intern and I (pharmacist) decided to give the epipen injection and patient agreed. We had the patient sit down for another 30 minutes as we monitored her. Minutes later, pt started to feel better as we continuously monitored her. During this time patient requested water due to dry mouth. We handed her a bottle of water but asked her to please sip and not take big gulps. After 30 minutes patient felt better. No swollen tongue, no difficulty swallowing or breathing and anxiety had been relieved. Patient was notified by pharmacy to call MD to let him know of reaction and was also told to call 911 immediately if have any further reaction. PT felt comfortable to leave at this point.

31 2021-01-25 ringing in ears Was fine immediately post vaccine. Drove home and proceeded with a normal rest of the day at home. W... Read more
Close
Was fine immediately post vaccine. Drove home and proceeded with a normal rest of the day at home. Went to sleep around 10 pm. Woke up at 4 am with my arm very sore. Got up to take meds for my arm pain and once I got to the bathroom felt pale, sweaty, nauseous and had chills, very weak - an overwhelming sense of not feeling right and strong fatigue. I sat on the toilet and went to the bathroom (urination and defecation) but did not have the energy to wipe properly. I stood up and turned on the sink faucet, took my meds with a few sips of water and next thing I remember is me laying on the bathroom floor confused and with my ears ringing. I figured I had laid down but then I realized the toilet was running and the sink faucet water was still running and I looked in the mirror and had a cut bleeding on my chin that I had no idea was there. Then I realized that I must have passed out while standing at the sink. I put a bandaid on the cut and went back to bed. In the morning when I was able to assess my self better, I realized during my fall/ fainting episode I had bitten my lip, cut my chin, had abrasions on my right thigh and left shoulder and bruised my right knee and some poop in my underwear I hadn't wiped properlyat the time, that's how out of it I was. I have never fainted or passed out ever before in my 31 years of life. I live alone and it was a very scary incident for me. Luckily my injuries were minor and I have recovered but I felt like I might die during the episode. My body had a very strong adverse reaction 12 hours post vaccine.

Patient received vaccination at 1:45 P.M. At 1;50 p.m. the patient collapsed. Her throat and tongue were swelling and she was having trouble breathing. She was not unconscious. At 1:52 p.m., epinephrine 0.3mg was administered to patient. She began to recover and swelling started decreasing, She was able to breath again. Shortly after this, the patient began to have more swelling of throat and tongue. Another dose of epinephrine 0.3mg was administered at 1:55 p.m. Again, the epinephrine worked quickly and patient was able to breathe again.
